title: Cancer Kids Upset Over Star's Act, Landmark Mental Health Lawsuit, Aussie Koala Rescue | 10 News+
description: Former NBA player Allen Iverson has come under fire during his trip Down Under after leaving a group of sick kids ‘let down’ after the meet and greet didn’t go to plan.  An Aussie farmer is being hailed a hero after rescuing a trapped koala from a bushfire by literally wrapping the animal up in the shirt off his back in Victoria.'  "A boyhood dream coming true at 70 years of age."  This group of Aussie blokes are proof that you are never too old to achieve your dreams, after Cricket Australia officially recognised them as representatives of Australia, gifting them their baggy greens. title: Trump Threats Iran With Airstrikes Unless It Makes A Deal Limiting Nuclear Weapons |  10 News
description: The US appears poised to strike Iran, with Donald Trump telling the regime time is running out to make a deal over its nuclear program.  But Iran has issued a threat of it's own, saying the country's armed forces have “their fingers on the trigger”. title: US Edges Closer To Shutdown After Senate Blocks Homeland Security Funding Bill | 10 News
description: The risk of a partial US government shutdown is rising after Democrats blocked a Senate funding package for Homeland Security.  The move denies Republicans the votes needed to pass the bill ahead of a midnight Friday deadline.  Democrats are demanding new limits on ICE operations following the fatal shootings of two protesters by federal agents in Minnesota.  Negotiations are continuing on a short-term extension to keep the government open. title: Palestinians Await Rafah Border Crossing Re-Opening | 10 News
description: Tens of thousands of Palestinians are awaiting the re-opening of the Rafah border crossing, Gaza's gateway to Egypt.  Health authorities say around 20,000 patients have medical referrals and are waiting permission to travel to receive treatment, with the Israeli government agreeing to a limited re-opening of the crossing.  The re-opening will also allow thousands of Gazans to be re-united with their families and according to one student, allow them to "go on with their lives" following the conflict with Israel. title: Shots Fired As Stolen Car Hits School Bus In Geelong | 10 News
description: Two people have been arrested after an allegedly stolen car crashed into a school bus and was driven at police during a pursuit in Geelong on Thursday.  Police fired two shots as the vehicle reversed into the bus in Newtown, with school children on board screaming and taking cover.  According to police, the Kia Optima, allegedly stolen from NSW, collided with another car before the occupants tried to flee on foot.  A 37-year-old man and 43-year-old woman were taken to hospital with non-life-threatening injuries, while no students or staff were hurt. title: Nine Entertainment Sells Talkback Radio Stations To Pub Tycoon Arthur Laundy For $56m | 10 News
description: Nine Entertainment has struck a 56-million-dollar deal with publican powerhouse Arthur Laundy selling its top-rating talkback radio slate - including 2GB, 3AW, 4BC and 6PR.  The move is understood to be part of Nine's digital-leaning strategy, with the family's negotiations led by former Liberal MP Craig Laundy.  The sale is subject to ACCC approval and is expected to be finalised by the end of June.
